lines.text: [Of Susan.]
Such a nice young thing. Not a bit like an American.
God will never forgive us, if we break faith with our dead again

[From his deathbed]
Tell me how they look, mother. Tell me how they march.
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Young Man

lines.text: [She gets up and goes to the window to watch the British and American soldiers parade together to the tune of "When Johnny Comes Marching Home Again."]
Do you see them yet?
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Young Man

lines.text: Yes, John, I see them. Your people and my people. Only their uniforms are different. How well, they march, John. How well they march together.
Tell me more, mother.
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Young Man

lines.text: There's a look of greatness upon them. All the strong young boys, beautiful and proud, with dreams. Just like you, John.
[He dies as she continues to watch the parade]
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Young Man

lines.text:
[while on a train leaving England for America]
Johnny, don't you want to go to America?
Oh yes, mother. If you do.
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Boy

lines.text: No, no. Tell me the truth. What are you thinking of sitting there so serious? I wouldn't for the world force you to do something you thought was wrong. But I do wish you could see it my way, darling. I want it so much.
Why, mother?
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Boy

lines.text: Because I'm afraid. I'm afraid of what's ahead. I'm afraid of another war. Your father died when he was young. He died for England, Johnny. But you're half American. You're my son. You belong to America too, not only England.
Mother, is that why we're running away?
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Boy

lines.text:
[Taken aback]
Running away?
Mother, there's a world war I want to fight for England. You wouldn't want me to be a coward, would you?
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Boy

lines.text: No, darling.
Mother.
Yes?
Do you think father would like me to run away?
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Boy

lines.text: No, Johnny. I don't.
[They hug as she tears up]
Darn little Englishman. You're just like your father.

[On his deathbed]
You know, Mother, I wasn't afraid.
lines.character: John Ashwood II as a Young Man

lines.text:
[Comforting]
I know.

[In bed with a food tray]
What in heaven's name is that?
It's suet pudding. You put syrup on it and eat it for dessert.
Do they eat it?
I've seen them.
What a people! You've got to hand it to them. They've certainly got intestinal fortitude!
